translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter with Sālakusumī as the Foremost Female Disciple
The Story of the Elder Avaṭṭa-phali
Seeing (him) with a fruit in my hand,🔽I approached the Lord of Men;
With a confident mind, full of joy,
I gave a fruit to the Avaṭa.
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving a fruit.
How welcome it was for me,
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus the elder Avaṭṭa-phali recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā avaṭaphaliyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Avaṭaphaliyattherassāpadānaṁ chaṭṭhaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai avaṭaphaliyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽avaṭaphaliya therassa apadānam chaṭṭha
translated: The Story of the Elder Avaṭṭa-phali is the sixth.
